thread.title: Carrie Fisher Had Her Ashes Put in a Prozac Pill-Shaped Urn
thread.title_full: Carrie Fisher Had Her Ashes Put in a Prozac Pill-Shaped Urn

title: Carrie Fisher Had Her Ashes Put in a Prozac Pill-Shaped Urn
text:
Most Popular Perfect. It's especially significant considering Fisher was a mental health advocate and very open about her own struggles. "I am mentally ill. I can say that. I am not ashamed of that. I survived that, I'm still surviving it, but bring it on. Better me than you," she told Diane Sawyer in 2001. After the funeral, Todd explained the vessel choice to reporters , "Carrie's favorite possession was a giant Prozac pill that she bought many years ago. A big pill," he said, "She loved it, and it was in her house, and Billie [Lourd, her daughter] and I felt it was where she'd want to be." "We couldn't find anything appropriate. Carrie would like that," he continued, "It was her favorite thing, and so that's how you do it. And so they're together, and they will be together here and in heaven, and we're OK with that." Fisher's urn calls to mind fellow Hollywood legend Zsa Zsa Gabor–who passed away on December 19 and had her ashes put in a Louis Vuitton bag. The funeral of Zsa Zsa Gabor takes place in LA today. The Louis Vuitton bag is believed to be carrying an urn with her ashes #ZsaZsaGabor pic.twitter.com/zVGP7IkA2e 
— David Mercer (@DavidMercerPA) December 30, 2016 Queens.
